definition: Wang Zhaojun (52-19 BC), famous beauty at the court of Han emperor Yuan 漢元帝|汉元帝[Han4 Yuan2 di4], one of the four legendary beauties 四大美女[si4 da4 mei3 nu:3]
surname Wang
king or monarch/best or strongest of its type/grand/great
to rule/to reign over
bright/clear/manifest/to show clearly
monarch/lord/gentleman/ruler

sentences.english: "Wang Zhaojun" is one of Caoyu's famous dramas in his late years.
sentences.chinese: 《王昭君》是曹禺先生晚年戏剧创作的代表作之一。

sentences.english: You know, Wang Zhaojun is one of "the four ancient beauties."
sentences.chinese: 王昭君是中国古代四大美女之一。

sentences.english: Thus the tale of Wang Zhaojun as it used to be told.
sentences.chinese: 以上说的，都是从前说王昭君的话头。

sentences.english: Daniel, this is the statue of Wang Zhaojun.
sentences.chinese: 大牛，这就是王昭君的雕像。

sentences.english: Her performance as Wang Zhaojun was very good.
Wang Zhaojun lived in the Huns? encampments for many years.
sentences.chinese: 王昭君出塞以后，生活在匈奴游牧地区几十年。

definition: Diaochan (-192), one of the four legendary beauties 四大美女[si4 da4 mei3 nu:3], in fiction a famous beauty at the break-up of Han dynasty, given as concubine to usurping warlord Dong Zhuo 董卓[Dong3 Zhuo2] to ensure his overthrow by fighting hero Lü Bu 呂布|吕布[Lu:3 Bu4]

Yang Yuhuan or Yang Guifei 楊貴妃|杨贵妃[Yang2 Gui4 fei1] (719-756), famous Tang beauty, consort of Emperor Xuanzhong 唐玄宗[Tang2 Xuan2 zong1], blamed for extravagance and killed as a scapegoat during the An-Shi Rebellion 安史之亂|安史之乱[An1 Shi3 zhi1 Luan4]
Daji (c. 11th century BC), concubine of the last Shang dynasty king Zhou Xin 紂辛|纣辛[Zhou4 Xin1]
Hua Mulan, legendary woman warrior (c. fifth century), Northern dynasties folk hero recorded in Sui and Tang literature
Houyi, mythological Chinese archer whose wife was Chang'e
Wu Zetian (624-705), Tang empress, reigned 690-705

Di Renjie (607-700), Tang dynasty politician, prime minister under Wu Zetian, subsequently hero of legends/master sleuth Judge Dee, aka Chinese Sherlock Holmes, in novel Three murder cases solved by Judge Dee 狄公案[Di2 gong1 an4] translated by Dutch sinologist R.H. van Gulik 高羅珮|高罗佩[Gao1 Luo2 pei4]
Han Xin (-196 BC), famous general of first Han emperor Liu Bang 劉邦|刘邦[Liu2 Bang1]
lily magnolia (Magnolia liliflora)
Mulan county in Harbin 哈爾濱|哈尔滨[Ha1 er3 bin1], Heilongjiang/see 花木蘭|花木兰[Hua1 Mu4 lan2]
Ying Zheng (260-210 BC), personal name of the first emperor 秦始皇[Qin2 Shi3 huang2]
Li Bai (701-762), famous Tang Dynasty poet
Zhong Kui (mythological figure, supposed to drive away evil spirits)/(fig.) a person with the courage to fight against evil
Athena
Nüwa (creator of humans in Chinese mythology)
same as Zhuangzi 莊子|庄子 (369-286 BC), Daoist author
Cheng Yaojin (589-665), aka 程知節|程知节[Cheng2 Zhi1 jie2], Chinese general of the Tang dynasty
